Under this provision, a taxpayer may receive a credit or refund for any excess tax paid on liquid held by a dealer before the enactment of the Act, intended for sale. Claims for credit or refund must be filed within 6 months of the Act's enactment, and dealers must request the refund from the taxpayer within 3 months. The taxpayer may receive a credit or refund for excess tax paid on liquid held by a dealer before the Act's enactment. The dealer must request the refund within 3 months, and certain rules apply, excluding fuel held in retail stocks. Definitions for "dealer" and "held by a dealer" are provided. SEC. 5. FLOOR STOCKS TAX. Imposition of Tax: A floor stocks tax is imposed on taxable liquid held by any person on the floor stocks tax date. The tax is the difference between what would be imposed under the Internal Revenue Code if the taxable event occurred on that date and the tax already paid on the liquid. Liability and Payment: The person holding the liquid is liable for the tax, which must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary within 6 months of the floor stocks tax date. Definitions: A liquid is considered "held by a person" if title has passed to that person. Definitions for the floor stocks tax section include the terms "held by a person," "taxable liquid," "floor stocks tax date," and "Secretary." Exceptions to the tax include exempt uses and fuel held in a vehicle tank. No tax imposed on taxable liquid in vehicle tank or held in floor stocks up to 2,000 gallons. Controlled groups treated as 1 person for tax purposes. For tax purposes, all persons in a controlled group are treated as one person. The term "controlled group" is defined as per section 1563 of the Code, with "more than 50 percent" replacing "at least 80 percent." Similar principles apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. Other laws, including penalties, apply to taxes imposed by chapter 31. All provisions of law, including penalties, applicable to taxes imposed by chapter 31 or 32 of the Code also apply to floor stock taxes imposed by subsection (a) to the same extent as if imposed by such chapter. The Speaker of the House of Representatives will establish a Commission on Gas Price Relief to study the causes of high oil prices and propose revenue raisers.
